label: John Lewis
bio: Elder son of William Lewis, who owned the John Lewis department store, London, Spedan join the business at 19 and in 1914 assumed control of Peter Jones in Sloane Square, London.

On his father's death he form the John Lewis Partnership and began distributing profits among its employees in the 1929. He transferred control of the company to the employees in the 1950 and resigned as chairman in 1955.

sub.label: Mary Lewis
bio: Mary Lewis was the wife of John Lewis. She was a philanthropist and a social worker

sub.label: Elizabeth Collins
sub.burialPlace: Sleepy Hollow Cemetery, New York, US
bio: Elizabeth Collins was the first wife of John Lewis. She was a social worker and a philanthropist

children.label: Steven Lewis
children.burialPlace: West Point Cemetery, New York, US
bio: Steven Lewis was the son of John Lewis and Elizabeth Collins. He was the first chairman of the John Lewis Partnership, which he co-founded with his father. He was also the first chairman of the Waitrose supermarket chain.
